column1: As our reporter entered Sir James Barrie's hotel room by one door
column2: the next door softly closed. "I was alone
column3: writes our reporter. I sprang into the corridor and had just time to see him fling himself down the elevator. Then I understood what he had meant when he said on the telephone that he would be ready for me at 10:30."I returned thoughtfully to the room
column4: where I found myself no longer alone. Sir James Barrie's "man" was there; a stolid Londoner
column6: who told me he was visiting America for the first time."Sir James is very sorry
column8: he assured me without moving a muscle. Then he added: But this is the pipe
column9: and he placed a pipe of the largest size on the table.The pipe he smokes?" I asked.Brown is evidently a very truthful man
column10: for he hesitated. "That is the interview pipe
column11: he explained. When we decided to come to America
column12: Sir James said he would have to be interviewed
column13: and that it would be wise to bring something with us for the interviewers to take notice of."
